examples: Every person has the right to express their opinions and beliefs.
The manager struck a rather insincere note as he expressed his sorrow at the round of layoffs.
He wanted to express his appreciation for all they had done, but words failed him.
Women should feel free to speak their minds and express themselves.
It is important to create a supportive environment where children can express their thoughts and emotions freely.
words.defineEn: to show or make a thought, feeling, etc. known by looks, words, or actions
words.defineVi: để hiển thị hoặc làm cho một suy nghĩ, cảm giác, vv được biết đến bằng vẻ ngoài, lời nói hoặc hành động

examples: Your wish is my command sire.
Her wish was my command
I wouldn't wish that professor on my worst enemy.
I wished him well with his new venture.
Don't you wish!
words.defineEn: a feeling of desire for something or of wanting something to happen
words.defineVi: một cảm giác mong muốn cho một cái gì đó hoặc muốn một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: With the promotion, the company's future is now in his hands.
The country's future is balanced on a razor's edge.
The whole future of the project is still up in the air.
A question mark hangs over the future of the company.
If sales don't improve, the company might not have a future.
words.defineEn: the time that will come after the present or the events that will happen then
words.defineVi: thời gian sẽ đến sau hiện tại hoặc các sự kiện sẽ xảy ra sau đó

words.defineEn: all the different stages of grow and development of a living organism
words.defineVi: tất cả các giai đoạn sinh trưởng và phát triển khác nhau của một sinh vật sống

examples: Their bread and butter is reporting local events.
The event finished with a spectacular fireworks display.
These events occurred within living memory.
The tragic event tore the community out of its sense of normalcy.
The paper’s bread and butter is reporting local events in a small community.
words.defineEn: anything that takes place, particularly something important
words.defineVi: bất cứ điều gì diễn ra, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó quan trọng

words.defineEn: to legally become someone's wife or husband
words.defineVi: để hợp pháp trở thành vợ hoặc chồng của một ai đó

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to hold, possess, or own an object or a quality
words.defineVi: để giữ, sở hữu, hoặc sở hữu một đối tượng hoặc một chất lượng

examples: Employees can retire at 60 if they choose.
Jim retired to raise raspberries.
When the CEO retired, the board of directors made the mistake of promoting the inexperienced intern to take his place.
Since he retired, Bill has too much time on his hands.
Even though I’ve retired, I still get up at 7 am by force of habit.
words.defineEn: to leave one's job and stop working, usually on reaching a certain age
words.defineVi: rời bỏ công việc của một người và ngừng làm việc, thường là khi đến một độ tuổi nhất định

examples: That experience changed my life.
The storekeeper changed my dollar bill for four quarters.
Leaves change colour in autumn.
The wind has changed direction.
The lights changed to green.
words.defineEn: to make a person or thing different
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người hoặc điều khác nhau

examples: Coach's career is on a sticky wicket.
Not even the most talented athlete is guaranteed a long career.
Long Island Marine and Olympian boxer Jamel Herring hangs up the gloves after championship career.
The freelance investigative reporter made a career of digging up dirt on celebrities for tabloids.
She started her career working for the BBC.
words.defineEn: a profession or a series of professions that one can do for a long period of one's life
words.defineVi: một nghề hoặc một loạt các nghề mà người ta có thể làm trong một thời gian dài của cuộc đời mình

examples: The children enjoyed a refreshing slice of watermelon on a hot summer day.
Parents often support their children financially during college.
The children threw the crumpled paper balls into the classroom trash can.
The children decorated their cupcakes on a colorful dish.
The children drank their juice from colorful plastic glasses.
words.defineEn: a young person who has not reached puberty or adulthood yet
words.defineVi: một người trẻ chưa đến tuổi dậy thì hoặc trưởng thành
